14 /*For 16 bytes string handler*/
15 #define DislayString16 16
16 
17 /*For 32 bytes string handler*/
18 #define DislayString32 32
19 
20 /*For 64 bytes string handler*/
21 #define DislayString64 64

30 static void check_maintenance( netsnmp_handler_registration *reginfo,
31  netsnmp_agent_request_info *reqinfo,
32  netsnmp_request_info *requests,
33  parameter *mib_param){
34  int ret = SNMP_ERR_NOERROR;
35  if ( mib_param->_mainenance_group && deviceInfo.parameters[num_DeviceMode]._value.int_val != maintenanceMode){
36  ret = SNMP_ERR_RESOURCEUNAVAILABLE;
37  netsnmp_set_request_error(reqinfo, requests, ret );
38  }
39 }

48 gboolean index_out_of_range( netsnmp_handler_registration *reginfo,
49  netsnmp_agent_request_info *reqinfo,
50  netsnmp_request_info *requests,
51  netsnmp_table_request_info *table_info,
52  int max_index){
53 
54  if ( *(table_info->indexes->val.integer) > max_index){
55  netsnmp_set_request_error(reqinfo, requests, SNMP_ERR_NOSUCHNAME );
56  return TRUE;
57  }else
58  return FALSE;
59 }

72 int handle_ROinteger(netsnmp_mib_handler *handler,
73  netsnmp_handler_registration *reginfo,
74  netsnmp_agent_request_info *reqinfo,
75  netsnmp_request_info *requests,
76  parameter *mib_param)
77 {
78  /* We are never called for a GETNEXT if it's registered as a
79  "instance", as it's "magically" handled for us. */
80 
81  /* a instance handler also only hands us one request at a time, so
82  we don't need to loop over a list of requests; we'll only get one. */
83  switch(reqinfo->mode) {
84 
85  case MODE_GET:
86  snmp_set_var_typed_value(requests->requestvb, ASN_INTEGER, (void*) &(mib_param->_value.int_val) ,sizeof(int));
87  break;
88 
89 
90  default:
91  /* we should never get here, so this is a really bad error */
92  snmp_log(LOG_ERR, "unknown mode (%d) in %s\n", reqinfo->mode, mib_param->_name);
93  return SNMP_ERR_GENERR;
94  }
95  return SNMP_ERR_NOERROR;
96 }
97 
98 int old_integer = -1;
107 int handle_RWinteger(netsnmp_mib_handler *handler,
108  netsnmp_handler_registration *reginfo,
109  netsnmp_agent_request_info *reqinfo,
110  netsnmp_request_info *requests,
111  parameter *mib_param
112  )
113 {
114  int ret;
115  /* We are never called for a GETNEXT if it's registered as a
116  "instance", as it's "magically" handled for us. */
117 
118  /* a instance handler also only hands us one request at a time, so
119  we don't need to loop over a list of requests; we'll only get one. */
120 
121  switch(reqinfo->mode) {
122 
123  case MODE_GET:
124  snmp_set_var_typed_value(requests->requestvb, ASN_INTEGER,
125  &(mib_param->_value.int_val), sizeof(int));
126  break;
127 
128  /*
129  * SET REQUEST
130  */
131  case MODE_SET_RESERVE1:
132  ret = netsnmp_check_vb_type(requests->requestvb, ASN_INTEGER);
133  if ( ret != SNMP_ERR_NOERROR ) {
134  netsnmp_set_request_error(reqinfo, requests, ret );
135  }
136  check_maintenance( reginfo, reqinfo, requests, mib_param);
137  break;
138 
139  case MODE_SET_RESERVE2:
140  /* XXX malloc "undo" storage buffer */
141  break;
142 
143  case MODE_SET_FREE:
144  /* XXX: free resources allocated in RESERVE1 and/or
145  RESERVE2. Something failed somewhere, and the states
146  below won't be called. */
147  break;
148 
149  case MODE_SET_ACTION:
150  /* XXX: perform the value change here */
151  old_integer = mib_param->_value.int_val;
152  mib_param->_value.int_val = *(requests->requestvb->val.integer);
153  /*Send a message during debug to inform the update had been performed*/
154  DEBUGMSGTL((mib_param->_name, "updated value -> %d\n",mib_param->_value.int_val ));
155  /*get possible errors*/
156  ret = netsnmp_check_requests_error(requests);
157  if (ret != SNMP_ERR_NOERROR) {
158  netsnmp_set_request_error(reqinfo, requests, ret);
159  }
160  break;
161 
162  case MODE_SET_COMMIT:
163  break;
164 
165  case MODE_SET_UNDO: /* will be executed only if some part of MODE_SET_ACTION fails */
166  mib_param->_value.int_val = old_integer;
167  ret = netsnmp_check_requests_error(requests);
168  if (ret != SNMP_ERR_NOERROR) {
169  /* try _really_really_ hard to never get to this point */
170  netsnmp_set_request_error(reqinfo, requests, SNMP_ERR_UNDOFAILED);
171  }
172  break;
173 
174  default:
175  /* we should never get here, so this is a really bad error */
176  snmp_log(LOG_ERR, "unknown mode (%d) in handle_%s\n",reqinfo->mode ,mib_param->_name);
177  return SNMP_ERR_GENERR;
178  }
179  return SNMP_ERR_NOERROR;
180 }

183 /*--------------------------------STRING--------------------------------*/

193 static int handle_ROstring( netsnmp_mib_handler *handler,
194  netsnmp_handler_registration *reginfo,
195  netsnmp_agent_request_info *reqinfo,
196  netsnmp_request_info *requests,
197  parameter *mib_param,
198  int length
199  )
200 {
201 
202  /* We are never called for a GETNEXT if it's registered as a
203  "instance", as it's "magically" handled for us. */
204 
205  /* a instance handler also only hands us one request at a time, so
206  we don't need to loop over a list of requests; we'll only get one. */
207 
208  switch(reqinfo->mode) {
209 
210  case MODE_GET:
211  snmp_set_var_typed_value(requests->requestvb, ASN_OCTET_STR,
212  mib_param->_value.string_val,MIN(strlen(mib_param->_value.string_val), length));
213  break;
214 
215 
216  default:
217  /* we should never get here, so this is a really bad error */
218  snmp_log(LOG_ERR, "unknown mode (%d) in %s\n", reqinfo->mode,mib_param->_name );
219  return SNMP_ERR_GENERR;
220  }
221 
222  return SNMP_ERR_NOERROR;
223 }
224 
233 int handle_ROstring16(netsnmp_mib_handler *handler,
234  netsnmp_handler_registration *reginfo,
235  netsnmp_agent_request_info *reqinfo,
236  netsnmp_request_info *requests,
237  parameter *mib_param)
238 {
239  return handle_ROstring(handler, reginfo, reqinfo, requests, mib_param, DislayString16);
240 }

268 int handle_ROstring64(netsnmp_mib_handler *handler,
269  netsnmp_handler_registration *reginfo,
270  netsnmp_agent_request_info *reqinfo,
271  netsnmp_request_info *requests,

277 
281 char old_string[64];
282 
291 int
292 handle_RWstring(netsnmp_mib_handler *handler,
293  netsnmp_handler_registration *reginfo,
294  netsnmp_agent_request_info *reqinfo,
295  netsnmp_request_info *requests,
296  parameter *mib_param,
297  int length)
298 {
299  int ret;
300  /* We are never called for a GETNEXT if it's registered as a
301  "instance", as it's "magically" handled for us. */
302 
303  /* a instance handler also only hands us one request at a time, so
304  we don't need to loop over a list of requests; we'll only get one. */
305 
306  switch(reqinfo->mode) {
307 
308  case MODE_GET:
309  snmp_set_var_typed_value(requests->requestvb, ASN_OCTET_STR,
310  mib_param->_value.string_val,MIN(strlen(mib_param->_value.string_val), length));
311  break;
312 
313  /*
314  * SET REQUEST
315  *
316  * multiple states in the transaction. See:
317  * http://www.net-snmp.org/tutorial-5/toolkit/mib_module/set-actions.jpg
318  */
319  case MODE_SET_RESERVE1:
320  /* or you could use netsnmp_check_vb_type_and_size instead */
321  ret = netsnmp_check_vb_type(requests->requestvb, ASN_OCTET_STR);
322  if ( ret != SNMP_ERR_NOERROR ) {
323  netsnmp_set_request_error(reqinfo, requests, ret );
324  }
325  check_maintenance( reginfo, reqinfo, requests, mib_param);
326  break;
327 
328  case MODE_SET_RESERVE2:
329  /* XXX malloc "undo" storage buffer */
330  if( strlen((char*) requests->requestvb->val.string) > length )
331  netsnmp_set_request_error(reqinfo, requests, SNMP_ERR_TOOBIG);
332  break;
333 
334  case MODE_SET_FREE:
335  break;
336 
337  case MODE_SET_ACTION:
338  /* XXX: perform the value change here */
339  /*realloc to the size of the string entered bu the user*/
340  strcpy( old_string, mib_param->_value.string_val);
341  strcpy(mib_param->_value.string_val,(char*)requests->requestvb->val.string);
342  /*Send a message during debug to inform the update had been performed*/
343  DEBUGMSGTL((mib_param->_name, "updated delay_time -> %s\n",mib_param->_value.string_val ));
344  /*get possible errors*/
345  ret = netsnmp_check_requests_error(requests);
346  if (ret != SNMP_ERR_NOERROR) {
347  netsnmp_set_request_error(reqinfo, requests, ret);
348  }
349  break;
350 
351  case MODE_SET_COMMIT:
352  break;
353 
354  case MODE_SET_UNDO:
355  /* XXX: UNDO and return to previous value for the object */
356  strcpy(mib_param->_value.string_val, old_string);
357  ret = netsnmp_check_requests_error(requests);
358  if (ret != SNMP_ERR_NOERROR) {
359  /* try _really_really_ hard to never get to this point */
360  netsnmp_set_request_error(reqinfo, requests, SNMP_ERR_UNDOFAILED);
361  }
362  break;
363 
364  default:
365  /* we should never get here, so this is a really bad error */
366  snmp_log(LOG_ERR, "unknown mode (%d) in handle_deviceUserDesc\n", reqinfo->mode );
367  return SNMP_ERR_GENERR;
368  }
369  return SNMP_ERR_NOERROR;
370 }
371
